title: Metacognition-Based Mobile Microlearning for Strengthening Industrial Electronics Practical Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental electrical/electronic theory and experience in constructing simple circuits
context.additional_context: Practice-centered modular learning environment for current professionals to resolve electronic control issues encountered in workplace operations

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of industrial electronic circuits using metacognitive strategies.
Learners can apply Ohm’s Law and Kirchhoff’s Laws to complex circuit analysis.
Learners can analyze and evaluate simulation results of electronic component simulations using digital learning tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
